about_description: The Egyptian Air Force, a museum that includes a large collection of aircraft that belong to the Egyptian army, including the Cairo Air Force 200, the Cairo Air Force 300, and the Air Force Edition. The museum is a guided tour by plane over Egypt's landmarks from Cairo.
history_description: The Egyptian Air Force is the military aviation branch of the Egyptian Armed Forces. It was established by a request submitted by the Egyptian parliament to the government in 1928 to be part of the Egyptian army, and a royal decree was issued later to convert it into an independent branch. Since its inception, the Egyptian Air Force has participated in most of the conflicts in which Egypt was a party, such as the 1948 war, the Yemen war, and the 1967 war. , the war of attrition, the October war in 1973, and the Egyptian-Libyan skirmishes. Emblem of the Egyptian Air Force The current commander of the Air Force is Lieutenant General / Mahmoud Fouad Abdel Gawad. The Egyptian Air Force currently has approximately 1,309 aircraft, including fighters and bombers, and about 321 helicopters, which makes the Egyptian Air Force the largest in both Africa and the Middle East. As for combat capabilities, the Egyptian Air Force is considered the strongest in Africa. The Egyptian Air Force has 20 main air bases out of 40 major air facilities, in addition to reserve and service bases spread throughout Egypt, and more than 30,000 personnel. The backbone of the Egyptian Air Force is 240 American-made F-16 Falcon fighters, making it the fourth largest user of these aircraft in the world. To the heights... for the sake of glory
